intro: Kalabotis paniculatum, commonly known as the panicled kalabotis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native habitat.
